title: This is pure ART. An unbiased and honest review.
text:
If you think action/combat choreography isn't a form of art then I'm sorry to say that you have a very skewed view of what art is.
Before I begin my review, on behalf of the more literate Bangladeshi's, I apologize for the bad reviews, please ignore the natives, they haven't even watched the movie, they're willfully putting in bad reviews just because they feel the Bangladeshi army was shown in poor light and that the environment doesn't look anything like Dhaka. But the fact is that, the army is indeed incompetent and highly corrupt. The plot doesn't take place within the city but on the outskirts, this literally proves the fact that they haven't watched the movie. The people putting in bad reviews should be ashamed of themselves, it's so easy to put in bad reviews. If you'll go through the reviews you'll easily know that most of them are just hate reviews without any legit reason. I made an account just to come in support for the people who have made this project a reality.The movie is a Gem, one of the best action films of the decade. I cannot believe this was out for Netflix, it truly deserves a big if not a huge screen. The first half of the movie is non-stop, literally breathless action. The hand to hand combat scenes were on par with the RAID films! I never thought I'd say this, atleast not so soon. They've pushed the limits as much as they could. The car chases in the outskirts of the city were shot extremely seamlessly and choreographed with unbelievable precision. The vfx and sound design is astoundingly neat and crisp, again wasn't really expecting it to be so damn good. The muzzle flares and gun shot effects were on point and as realistic as they could get. The editing is so clean you'll never know the transitions between the takes.
Sam Hargrave, the director, is truly a master of his craft. He knew exactly what he was doing. There's a long extended action scene or a (Oner) which I don't want to spoil for anyone, it's probably the best one-take action sequences I've witnessed in a long time. You think John Wick and Atomic Blonde had cool slick action, wait till you watch this movie. There's some meaty stuff in here for Action nerds and the kind of gun-fu I haven't seen before. You will never be able to anticipate the moves. The stunt choreography was so meticulously and precisely designed, I cannot fathom the level of expertise it would have taken for them to have practised the whole sequence, to remember every move and have executed them in such a precise manner, is so f**king impressive. This is some premium stuff right here. Chris has done all the stunts and combat scenes by himself which is highly commendable. There's a lot of hard work that's gone behind this project and it is clearly visible. Indian actor Randeep Hooda has also done a commendable job especially during the action sequences and that one ridiculously stunning knife fight.
Loved Hemsworth's emotional performance as well, he's a big mean beast with a soft heart and it shows. With this movie Chris Hemsworth can well and truly join the big leagues of pure action movie stars. Not that he wasn't one before, but the stuff he's done in this film is particularly spectacular. I cannot wait for a sequel or even another project from Hargrave. He had my curiosity, but now he's definitely got my attention. There should be more support in favour of projects such as these. I think this is by far the best Action original from Netflix. Do yourself a favour by not missing it. What else are you doing in the lockdown anyway? Totally worth a re-watch.

title: A PURE ACTION SEQUENCE
text:
Extraction has a very short story which can be expressed in a line: a young boy is kidnapped; a mercenary is sent out to rescue him.
That boy is Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the son of a jailed Indian drug lord (Pankaj Tripathi). The one-man rescue operation is Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth).Ovi was kidnapped by Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli), Bangladesh's biggest drug lord, who also controls the country's police and military,in Dhaka. Ovi, who lives in Mumbai with his father's underling, Saju (Randeep Hooda) who was in Indian Special Forces before,who knows a team that can bring the boy back to India.Tyler reaches the kidnapper's den: we get a longish violent showdown. Ovi and Tyler manage to escape: we get an even longer action set piece. The climax is expectedly more violent, where all the characters converge with an assortment of weapons.In the worst sceniario when things get complicated,all the world want Tyler to leave Ovi in Dhaka to save himself,he ensures Ovi that he will leave Dhaka only with Ovi though he will not get the money as he does not want to loss another child's life after losing his own child who was died by cancer.From then it was purely action sequence like car chasing in congested areas of Dhaka,fighting with cops,escaping from the guards etc with very limited story line.Based upon rural areas of Dhaka,it shows the effective power of Drug lord on the country's Security forces,Child labour including training them with varieties of heavy weapons from very young age to be extremist.From here on,someone attacks, someone counterattacks, someone monitors and plans.Screenplay by Joe Russo was good though the shots were too yellowish to show the impact of the rurality of Dhaka.When it comes to individual performances,Chris Hemsworth was outstanding at action sequences,dialogue delivering(specially those Bengali word "Proman Dao").The boy(Rudhrash) was equally good in screen but Randep Hooda as Saju was exceptional,his dedication towards the whole screenplay was fabulous,he hardly has left any fault to criticize.However for a pure entertainment and Action sequence adventure,You can surely give it a watch.

title: amazing directorial debut
text: Sam Hargrave! His first long picture and he's teaching the best how to shoot an action flick! Boy, what a directorial debut. That's some smooth camera work! At last, a director who turns the camera into the direction of the action! For example when the camera is nicely tucked in the backseat during a car scene and makes for some amazing shots. Don't forget the fight during the extraction! Especially the scenes in the apartment block where the camera follows a cop entering the compound during the pursuit. At one point it's too much! Agreed. But it's too much finely executed. It could've been better storywise. Yes of course, especially the ending. All that being said I can't wait for his next film. With all the bad movies shot these days I just hope Hollywood realizes this guy is a gem. Get him a great script and let him roll. He'll be fine. If this is the quality we get when Stuntmen become Directors than they all need to change careers, fast!

title: Refreshing return to believable and satisfying action
text:
The film is well cast with good solid performances from everyone involved. Nice to see Hemsworth playing an Australian, he is right at home and it shows with the typical quiet depth and preference for action over explanation inherent in most Aussie blokes I know displayed very well.
If you're a bit jaded by the Hollywood obsession for more and more improbable And overblown action scenes in movies of the genre you'll enjoy this film.
There isn't a ton of story but those few moments had some real depth and were exceptionally well acted.
Definitely worth a watch.
Bumped the score a little to compensate for the location low blows. It's a shame there was some inaccuracy but this film is entertaining and the creative choices still work well for this particular story.

title: Tense Gripping Action
text: Hard, gritty, well fleshed out characters and tight, tense action scenes make this an excellent, fast paced watch.The overall hue of the movie is army green, dusty desert, makes one think of Vietnam. Voices are low pitched and actors native to the shooting and movie locale largely used.The movie makes great use of cinematography, combines sounds expertly between background music and noise in the environment to keep the tension going.Chris Hemsworth does a great serious turn in this role. His most famous role, Thor, is heroic, funny, jokey. Tyler is dark, brooding, fearless and Hemsworth brings that very well.Great fast paced non stop action; well worth watching!

title: No emotion, no connection....not anywhere near any of the films in the Marvel universe
text: Sure, Bangladesh is not depicted properly. It's just an imaginary dhaka shown in the film. A movie bringing together India and Bangladesh in a context, could have been pretty good. There could have been some efforts showing some degree of corruption or systemic error that leads to the actions.But this film is just full of ****. The actions are awesome. If the film realised that the host country has much more to offer then depicted, could have made the film worth watching. Rather, the entire film is shot at , what, 500 metres of set. Everything is repetitive.And there can be no country where the military is run by Mafia. That is absurdity to the highest. Sure there can be some corruption at some level, but that should not attribute all. Remember, winter soldier? Corruption was there. But there was a conflict with the good within Hydra.In this film, there was no corruption. Nothing. Just people swinging AK47. Guns are illegal in the country. How come so many AK 47 there on the street, why would kids be carrying guns? What was the director thinking?Think about it. If you a bunch of mercenaries start shooting missiles and gunning down police without any showing any intention to discuss anything, that depicts terrorism isn't it? Then who is the bad guy here? The police or Chris? What is the logic?Watching the full movie, I did not get any sense of any hatred between the two rival gangs. It's just pointless shooting.

title: CHRIS HEMSWORTH IS EXCELLENT IN THIS EXCELLENT EXCITING & GRIPPING ACTION THRILLER
text:
Chris Hemsworth has proved he's now one of the best leads in Hollywood, we know he's fantastic as Thor from the Marvel universe but here he's taken on the type of brutal, gritty fast paced action hero lead role that Jason Statham or Liam Neeson might've done!!!
Hemsworth is excellent here & gives a fantastic tough as hell performance as troubled mercenary Tyler Rake & he's one extremely deadly & well trained Black market mercenary with a nothing to lose attitude & a fearless warrior instinct, a great character. Tyler has been hired to find & rescued a kidnapped boy who is held for ransom but the kid is the son of a crime lord. This is set in the dangerous & violent underworld city of Bangladesh & the action is bone crunching, frantic, gritty & full of realism. The town is locked down & full of gangs out hunting for Tyler & the boy (a good performance by Rudhrakish Jaiswal) & these two are ferociously hunted by not just the criminals of the ghettos but also by a deadly Assassin played by Randeep Hooda, a fantastic performance & one hell of a great character who is just as good as Chris Hemsworth here!!!I loved the scary & dangerous atmosphere & the frantic explosive action that bursts out of nowhere & makes everything feel on edge & intense. An exciting survival Thriller that feels real & intense as hell. A wild thrilling ride with great performances & gory blood soaked action.

title: Extraction is not Dhaka
text: 1. The movie represented that Dhaka is a city of drugs and crimes. It showed that DMP, Bangladesh Army, and even Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) are working for the Drug Lord of Dhaka. Using all these three Defence Forces working for the Drug Lord was an insanely bad idea. They could have used one instead of all three. It felt like Dhaka is a dark city where killing people is a normal thing on the street during daylight. Just like Mexico.2. In the movie, the director used kids to shoot gun fires. Using kids and representing them as the source of crime demeaned our reputation. I never expected that Dhaka will be presented so badly in our first collaboration with a Hollywood movie using kids. Are we so down to earth that we have to use kids for that? Okay, the director wanted to make it more realistic but I felt that he wanted to bring the ISIS vibe where we saw pictures of kids with guns.3. Why the Hell the Drug Lord of Dhaka cannot speak proper Bangla? They could have used our artists for that. I guess The Drug Lord of Dhaka was from India. It was depressing.

title: Tyler Rake
text: A fun action movie with superbly directed action scenes and a good cast. The cinematography is good, and the action is brutal, tense and bloody.Extraction is a surprisingly good action film that doesn't pretend to be anything else. The cast is solid, and the choice of characters is interesting. Chris Hemsworth is excellent as Tyler Rake.The action scenes are tense, superbly choreographed and the direction is excellent. Chris Hemsworth is definitely the right choice for this role.We also have some background stories about the main character, Tyler Rake, and so we reveal some details from his life and what makes him who he is. This is skillfully incorporated into the story without the film losing anything of the suspense and quick sequence of events.Most movies today are thrash, especially those made for streaming services, but this one is surprisingly entertaining, with great action scenes and a good cast. Excellent directing, tense and brutal action scenes, solid cast and constant action.A simple, brutal, adrenaline-fueled ride with great action scenes.

In some respects it felt confusing.A solid 9 stars for a good action movie.

title: A tribute to the genre
text:
Whoever was born in the 80s grew up with a very strong incentive for action films, due to the influence of parents, the trend in the industry, the television network, investment in rental companies, everything conspired in favor of the still inexistent term "shot, punch and bomb ", It was undeniable the happiness to see the films with stars of the genre. Currently, productions are very restricted when looking for some quality or some component that attracts all the attention and transforms the film, in fact, good; there are examples, of course, but with the number produced, the result should be better. This conspired for a feeling of emptiness in the hearts of fans of this iconic genre and when we come across a good production, the heart beats with happiness, that's the truth! Who hasn't been thrilled with John Wick? Action films can be very chic, just that the cinema made use all the good in your favor.The Rescue is an adaptation of HQ Ciudad, written by Ande Parks and the Russo brothers and is a project with long dates. Before it was released, the intention to take it to the cinema already existed, but many things have changed since then. The story narrates a mission by a black market mercenary whose objective is to rescue the daughter of a South American drug dealer, this in HQ; when starting the project, in 2012, the protagonist would be the star The Rock and the direction and cast was completely different, but everything changed, who took the lead was Chris Hemsworth, another thing was also the setting, exchanging south america for india and Thailand. The new chairman was Sam Hargrave, who has a long career as a stuntman in Hollywood and has acted as a stuntman and stunt coordinator in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, these names generated great expectations and the result could not have been anything else, one great action movie.When cinema is made with passion and by those who understand it, it is another level, not that others do not know, but being specific here, I refer to what the film proposes, action. the script is simple and common, the protagonist who is almost an army, traumatized and usually drinking, leaving for a mission that may be the last; there are many films with this premise and it is normal to some extent, what will differentiate is how it will be presented and developed, how the aspects will be addressed, the relationship between the rescuer and the rescued is an example of this, and how the setting will be built. I can say that the choice of a director (even if he is new to the chair) experienced in what is really action in the lens, was the biggest hit of this film, without a doubt. The realism presented is impressive from the first minutes, it does not take long for the director to put the camera in his hand and go out with everything, his experience helps to put himself in the right point of the take, in the exact rotation. By opting for less stuntmen on the scene, the audience's approach was also greater, the protagonist is present in many scenes that usually the face would be hidden, the style of filming also deserves to be highlighted. Hargrave uses several techniques to embody his film, the camera in hand already mentioned is used at various times to bring this realism, for sure the director lay down, knelt down and got up running to follow everything he wanted to capture, the dense scenery of an Indian city with those tight streets, full of people, cars, boxes, animals and everything that can be placed there, contributed a lot to the frantic and agonizing rhythm. There is an excellent sequence plan, another sequence that looks like a video game cutscene; the camera takes the action from the front, turns to the side, climbs, turns, swings, a door opens, shows the action of the character (engaging a gear), turns the look again, turns forward and continues, it is sensational.The action scenes with hand-to-hand combat are of a high level too, everything is organic and no matter how much you look for a defect it is difficult to find, again, the camera works well in the movements and everything happens, fight with a knife, shots with different weapons , neutralization sequences that make everything more plastic, shot in the foot, in the body, in the head, rotate the gun for better positioning of the body, change the type of weapon, return to the knife, go to the hand ... phew !!! It's really frantic. I couldn't imagine this film in America, the locations contribute a lot to the geography and the profile, the feeling of crowding at all times causes a claustrophobic effect and the yellowish filter causes a mixture that warms everything, that place looks like a hell of hot. At various times I found myself making comparisons with John Wick, for the plasticity, ignorance and at the same time, the subtlety in worrying about the details to make everything perfect in the eyes of the viewer.
The cast is very lean and obviously pulled by its biggest star, Hemsworth is an actor who has shown himself to be quite versatile, including in comedies. Here he is very well and has his role outside the MCU, I am not surprised if he stops being Thor, for some, and becoming the "rescue guy", the commitment to production brought an excellent result. David Harbor is another name known to the general public, but his character is very shy in production and has no prominence. On the other hand, Randeep Hooda, who plays the kidnapper's coast guard, deserves more attention. Hooda is very well known in the Hindu scene and brought a commitment equal to that of the protagonist, most of the best scenes involve his character and, as I said, the result is very good. The rest of the cast follows a well-defined acting pattern that does not compromise on anything, there is no one to say "this actor is too bad", despite having a very caricature tone in some. I understand that it was due to the Indian style, many actors work in Hindu cinema and have their own characteristics, the lack of custom in watching Bollywood films creates a certain visual barrier, I recommend even paying attention to this industry, which like any other, it has its mistakes and successes.The Rescue is a film that arrives to fill a gap and finally marks a hit by Netflix in blockbuster-like productions, pushing the mind, for example, Squadron 6. It is a great choice for today and is very worthwhile increase, especially if you are part of the generation that had a lot of fun with the eighteenth-century troglodytes. It draws attention for the already praised work of the director who, like Chad Stahelski, goes on the radar. At the end of the film, I only had a smile because the air was gone.

title: Reviewed
text:
Extraction - A 1h 56 min action , thriller movie released on April 2020 on the platform of Netflix.
The movie is directed by Sam Hargrave, and stars Chris Hemswort (Tyler Rake), Bryon Lerum(Rake's son), Ryder Lerum(Rake's son ) , Randeep Hooda (Saju), Rudraksh Jaiswal (Omi Mahajan) and others.
This new Netflix original action movie is based on a graphic novel co authored by the Russo brothers.
The movie Extraction sees Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth)as a black market mercenary , who is enlisted to rescue the kidnapped son (Rudhraksh Jaiswal)of an imprisoned international crime lord.
The movie has impressive camera work and action sequence.
It's surely a gun fight action movie with some great hand to hand combat scenes.
Although to bring in some criticism , the movie lacked some logic and purpose of reality , with a poor story line.
But if one is looking for entertainment , you shouldn't miss watching it.
The movie somewhere lies in between good and bad.
The movies definitely has some of the best pure action choreogtaphy and cinematography .
Extraction seems fortunately timed for its streaming rollout which could atleast momentarily satisfy people deprived of the big screen.
For the attractive cast and sleek cinematography the movie can be definitely watched for entertainment and action lovers.

title: What i expected -which is fine by me
text: This movie is pretty much what you probably expected. There are many movies out there, like this one. Complete this impossible mission, lots of action. Some people have given it very low ratings, and it will probably sadly get even more bad ratings - because people wanted it to be more "different" than the other movies within the genre. However, if you want a classic action packed movie, this is the one. The action is top notch, and i really enjoyed it. Don't watch this movie if you are looking for something very new and surprising. This is a really good movie that works well within its genre. I recommend it, because i love some good action scenes -also, Chris Hemsworth does a very good job! Great acting

title: Great movie. Best action flick of this year.....
text: Extraction's USP is the action it offers: beautifully shot, neatly choreographed and well-edited too. Those fed up of quick cuts in recent action movies would be pleasantly surprised to find long takes in this film (in this case, a prolonged single-shot action sequence!) instead of fast cutting. The color tone is rich and suits the film's own tone. There are a couple of dramatic breaks between the action that make the viewers root for the characters.Chris Hemsworth delivers an impressive performance that gels with his character, while Rudraksh Jaiswal also presents us with a neat act. It's finally very satisfying to see Randeep Hooda doing a character like this. Make no mistake, he's done a couple of action films before but never did he play a tough character like this: one that allows him to both throw a punch and emote whenever needed.Extraction is also surprisingly realistic in terms of how it doesn't want to turn heroes into indestructible characters. When they get hit, they bleed. When they are injured, they feel pain. And given how all of this is done masterfully during its video-game style action, Extraction fulfills the action genre to its fullest. Again, since there's no way one's gonna step out and pay to buy tickets and popcorn to a movie at this moment, it's better to stay home, grab some snacks and prepare yourself for a thrill-a-minute, no-nonsense action ride called Extraction. Action aficionados are definitely in for a massive treat.

title: John Wick, Sicario and Rambo
text:
John Wick, Sicario and Rambo are three of my favorite action movies of all time. These are great action movies. Extraction is just an average one because three main reasons.First, acting is pretty poor. I do not expect an Oscar winner as a lead actor, but Keanu, Benicio and even Sly, are more credible than Chris. I like Chris but not here. I didn't feel any empathy for him.Second, the script is pretty weak and the ending a joke. Again, I do not expect too much, but there are a bunch of extremely unbelievable situations and decisions by the characters that makes this movie sometimes awkward.Last, the use of CGI here is not bad but some explosions looked cheap and the scene jumping from the waterfall and then doing underwater meditation was embarrasing.
There are many examples of good action movies with a low budget but pretty real, raw and brutal. Check action scenes on Rambo 4 to see what I am talking about.
So, overall an average action film to watch during the lockdown. Forgettable after it.

Bangladesh, a small country located in South Asia, has a history of sacrificing themselves for the country. It's peace loving and heartful to the foreigners. I think the movie 'Extraction' was produced just to conquer the market of India by Netflix. There was no story, boring action. The only question I want to ask to the producers that, 'Did they ever visited Dhaka'. I think they had better visit Dhaka and make the film. Guys, this is totally a disaster I think. Better to watch BLOODY INDIAN Bollywood films.

title: EXTRACT THIS ADRENALINE RUSH
text: Every once in a while a movie comes along that makes one wonder how did they do that and do it so well? Here we are and this is that movie. First off, Hemsworth is finding his niche and excelling in it. He has his body and his acting lined up and the audience likes both. The director took that and his skills and gave us a adrenaline rush of a movie so action-packed that not only makes the point of not giving up but things aren't over until they are. Good story, twists, special forces, weapons galore and the scenery or locations are impressive for their realism. Might I also point out that we get some good closure at the end which viewers must have if movies like this will thrive. Highly recommend a tasty snack or two (to ward off biting nails) and a tasty drink

title: Brain dead plot surrounding rock-solid action
text: This film made me finally understand that achieving mindless action that is actually entertaining is a skill. Even if you shut your brain off to enjoy the exciting shots and punches thrown, you will eventually wipe the drool away and realize that the plot is ridiculous. The character motivations turn from questionable to directly contradictory. The protagonists clearly become the bad guys, but not in a way that feels like the director wants you to think they are the bad guys. I am surprised Russo wrote this screen play and even more surprised that he let it materialize. Great action though.

title: Definately in the TOP 5 list of my action genre.
text:
I just cannot understand how the rating went down over 1 point in under 24 hours. Perhaps expectations superseded understanding of an excellent production. Especially when reviews are cloudy, wishy washy and just thrown out there for the sake of writing one.To be fair, the moment I saw the names Chis Hemsworth and Joe & Anthony Russo one could only imagine the child in me after watching Endgame.
I thought, even for a fiction flick of this nature, there was depth, intelligence and outstanding performances from Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda. The action sequences were incredible, for lack of a better word and the story line is quite believable considering the real world.For me, watching a great movie means that I have to be drawn to it from beginning to end. I went into the film with a lot of expectation considering the likes of 13 Hours and Lone Survivor. Because of the outcome of it, the depth in the performances of Chris and Randeep, and the music score that adds to the intensity, I would watch it again. Not too soon, but I would. Netflix did it!

title: Thor. Where is your POWA?!
text: Who you going to call? A White Savior.Chris Hemsworth is basically Punisher in this installment.The movie is about a guy trying to save a boy from the slums of India. It's full on war. Why? I have no idea. Don't know much about the main guy other than he is a very skilled combatant. that mean development isn't perfect.The acting is fine. Most of the Indians don't speak English.There is a lot of bullets and bloodshed. This is the first time children get harmed on screen. Which makes it realistic and unPC. Children are used as fearless mercenaries. Thor isn't afraid to harm them either.This movie is not made for children of these days. They'd get puny nightmares.The movie showed a lot of the slums of India. title: Full of well-choreographed, brutal action sequences
text: Characters worth rooting for help the serviceable story resist giving way under the immense pressure caused by the brutal action sequences.When a mercenary (Chris Hemsworth) is hired to rescue the kidnapped son of an imprisoned crime lord, events quickly spiral out of control as the relatively simple extraction mission turns deadly. Hemsworth must protect the boy from many enemies as he tears through the Bangladesh concrete jungle with kinetic force.As indicated, the story is propped up by its action. Containing one of the best long takes committed to an action film, the scene looks as complicated technically as it is viscerally intense. Directed by stuntman Sam Hargrave, he directs with an efficiency that belies his filmmaking experience, delivering a furious amount of John Wick-inspired violence that is certain to get the adrenaline going.Overall, this is a solid thriller that demonstrates how to execute action for maximum impact, delivering all the pain with enough skill to make for an awesome experience.8/10

title: Many people got hurt in the making of this film
text:
Acting: 9/10
Great cast with awesome performances from chris Hemsworth and the kid. The villains are also done well where you do sincerely dislike them. This isnt a drama so Rambo acting is good enough for me.Cinematography/fight scenes: 11/10
Absolutely the highlight of this film is the fight scenes and action scenes. The technical application is 10/10. The director of this is a stunt co coordinator for many famous films and he shows his skill here. Every shot, punch, death is immersive and feels powerful and real. They have long scenes that are blended and cut so insanely well. This is up there and imo better than "hitmans bodyguard" and "kingsman" when it comes to action scenes. I promise you many, many many stunt men were hurt in the making of this.Story: 6.5/10
As everyone states yes it doesnt have the best of story. Is it bad? Hell no. It's just typical. It's interesting throughout, you care for the main characters. The end is a nice send off and is symbolic/foreshadowed well. It's just nothing new but that's okay.Summary:
This is top 3 best ever action stunt movies out there. The story isnt anything new, but it's good.
if your a action flick fan then you should have a blast watching this!

title: Great action movie
text: I went in with low expectations, expecting Extraction to be another crappy run of the mill action movie like Netflix has produced dozens of over the last few years (I'm especially looking at you, 6 Underground and Spenser Confidential). I was therefore very pleasantly surprised to see just how well crafted this movie is. It has excellent grounded action scenes, great set pieces, fantastic cinematography (I'm a sucker for those epic long takes) and a surprising amount of emotion in large part thanks to amazing performances by Chris Hemsworth and the kid who plays Ovi.True, the story isn't too much to write home about, but it gets the job done setting up the action that is the bulk of the movie. And of course it's an action movie in which one guy manages to take out entire armies so be prepared to suspend your disbelief a bit, but thanks to the excellent execution it never took me out of It. The movie catches its breath a few times and doesn't feel dull in those moments, thanks to the interactions between Hemsworth and the kid. Didn't know this movie was partially produced by the Russo brothers, but it made total sense after seeing it.If you like well executed action movies that don't just rely on CGI explosions and fast editing, give this a watch. You probably won't regret it. At least I didn't.

title: Waste of Money and Time as an action Film
text:
Personal Rating 1.5/10In parallel to their creative liberty, I also take my consumer liberty to share severe disappointment on the substandard delivery from below persons in charge.Sam Hargrave - Director
Casting - Sarah Halley Finn, Tess Joseph, Soham Mad and Ayan Mad
Production Supervisor Bangladesh - Tariq Anam Khan
Production Manager Bangladesh - Lylie Almeida
Key Location Manager - Mary Barltrop & Luke Torrevillas
Location Manager Bangladesh - Ariq Anam Khan
Dialect Coach - Rafael Ahsan
Tutor - Prarav Ajmera
Bengali Interpreter - Mahua Banerjee
Production designer - Phill Ivey
Costume Designer, Bojana Nikitovic
Music- Manish Raval, Tom Wolfe, Henry Jackman & Alex Belcher
Unit Production Manager - Patrick Newall
Set Designer - Nicholas Dare
Art Directors - Charlie Revai and Harrison YurkiwCreative excellence or even minimal quality was surely not the focal point of this production. It was all about developing a profitable product for a broader consumer market. Casting two established Bollywood actors (at lower wage), paying for hindi music bits, faking Kolkata locations and ambience as Dhaka and casting Thor himself was to bag in the greater usual netflix crowd from India. Putting the name Dhaka and just showing freelance drone-shots of the city and shamelessly fooling around with inappropriate accent, language, culture and ambience along with lack of any Bangladeshi actor still brings in Bangladeshi viewers. Engaging a reputed line producer from Bangladesh and well portraying the country was not a big deal but I guess Netflix cautiously ignored it.Hence, Netflix will certainly recover the investment with full profit. But for the creative hats looking into the mirror, it's hard not to regret for such pricy and smelly trash.

If you're going to rate movies on how realistic the cities look and become overly critical at how accurate the culture is etc, then I really think you need to reconsider even watching films like this in the first place... I say great work on delivering an enjoyable Action Packed Film with talented actors, realistic looking fight scenes, & well executed stunts that keep you on the edge of your seat the whole way thru.

title: By-the-numbers story that brings plenty of action with a dependable Hemsworth at the helm
text: The good: The action. This is first and foremost an action movie. And on that front it delivers. Steady, raw and visceral action set pieces and fight scenes make for extremely entertaining viewing (if action's your jam). The 11+ minute one-shot is fantastic and doesn't just come across as a neat trick, but actually helps pull you into the action and feel the exhaustion of the characters as they weave their way through the bad guys. Masterfully done.The bad: The predictable plot is just a vehicle for the action, and the characters (both pro/antagonists) are mostly cliches.Should I watch it? If you like action then yes. Definitely. The action and fight choerography is top-notch and Chris Hemsworth is rock-solid as the lead. Highly recommended.

title: A Highly Rewatchable Entertaining Action Flick
text: Extraction is a brainless action film, which not only understands its identity, but under the competent helm of Sam Hargrave, is executed beautifully. Many action films feel the need to insert shaky hand-held camera (I'm looking at you Michael Mann), or worse still, frenetic cuts that are challenging to follow, but it's the use of steady-cam, and the smooth pacing, that really makes the film easy to watch.With plenty of shoot-outs, some fine looking explosions (though one is a little hit and miss), plenty of guys being thrown left and right by the protagonist, and the inclusion of the best knife fight I have seen since Jeong-Beom Lee's The Man From Nowhere, this film has virtually everything 'cept the kitchen sink. I had heard the film's violence was viscerally exaggerated, though I would disagree. It's no Freddy Vs. Jason, but it's no Jason Bourne either, so expect to see your fair share, but you won't ever need a towel to wipe it from your screen.A good action film needs an equally great villain accompanying it. Extraction, in this department, is rather lacking. Priyanshu Painfulli portrays drug-lord Amir, whose innumerable henchmen and child soldiers are enforced by Shataf Figar as the Colonel, who can authoritatively shut down the city of Bangladesh in a heartbeat when crap hits the fan. These characters are similar to The Voice in Man on Fire; rarely ever seen, yet their influence is around every corner. To exacerbate their ruthlessness, more screen-time was needed.The use of metaphor is well inserted on occasion, through dialogue and accompanying visuals, and it is this that perhaps gives the most depth to Chris Hemsworth's Tyler, other than the moments when he simply tells us his backstory to strangers, akin to Cruise and Foxx in Collateral (without the antagonism). He portrays a larrikin mercenary, his genuine Australian accent accentuating his tough guy image (because who doesn't like a good occa?), his boyish charms and poignant backstory making him incredibly likable. Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the teenager he is assigned to 'extract' from Amir, who has had him kidnapped for not only a large sum, but to show his imprisoned father who's boss, is also equally enjoyable to watch, and though he receives the same lacking amount of characterization, his humanity is an engraved part of the film.Randeep Hooda joins the cast as Saju, a bodyguard whose intentions are initially difficult to fathom, though his limited characterization reveals a family-man buried beneath his grizzled exterior. David Harbour's Gaspar, who is in the film for probably all of eight minutes, portrays a character who believes the end justifies the means, while Golshifteh Farahani as Nik, is easily the only character capable of stealing the light from Hemsworth. A brilliant tactician, who can control any situation, and can wield all manner of conventional firearms - she is the ultimate waifu.At the end of the day, the story is pretty bare-bones; boy gets kidnapped and must be rescued, with predictable double-crosses abound, though that doesn't make it any less entertaining, or recommendable - at the same time though, it is forgettable, requiring little in the way of brain power. For a film that occasionally breaks the 'show don't tell' rule of cinema, the end is very much multi-interpretative, adding depth to an otherwise two-dimensional feature. I personally think Hemsworth should be in more movies like this; gritty fun action films that remind us of decades earlier, when movies were more concerned with entertainment, instead of politics, whilst Hargrave has equally shown us that stuntmen, much like Chad Stahelski and David Lietch, make for some of the best action directors in the business today.

title: Decent action, ludacris plot
text: In the 80s, youd have one-man-army films that worked because they we over the top or fun etc. So it still made sense if the plot was razor thin. The problem with making a film like this one so gritty and realistic and violent and dark, is that the plot and script must also represent this. This script and story dont even try.The entire premise makes no sense...they insist on saving one kid for an evil drug lord...but dont mind killing 100 or 200 other people with children of their own who are just following orders and are probably just decent policemen who have no idea what's going on.And they wont even get paid for it.And theyll all probably die.And, somehow, in the opener, one guy double crossed them and knew exactly where all his team was, even the guy in the woods. Such a bad lazy script all around meant only, one mist assume, to practice new stunts and choreography.Beyond that, it is obvious that you will know all the cliches and tropes. But. You wont see some of the car hits coming because they are well shot, but also completely nonsensical since they come one after another, yet no one sees are hears them coming...again and again. Are the streets in india or Bangladesh covered in silent and cloaked electric vehicles? How about a gun and knife battle with cars and people that see it and completely ignore it and just try to get in the way of it. I mean, it is action and looks cool, if not real all the time, but it makes you groan often.The acting is actually good all around, even the kid.Oh, and of course, a beautiful woman gets the last kill without warning or explaining any of it, including what exactly physically makes her equipped to be such a character or how she possibly gets near the villain.Frustrating. So much talent involved and it's just another one of these movies...

title: Sam Hargrave delivers a brutal and impressive debut.
text: There's sure to be an outcry over the violence or the flimsy narrative that Extraction possesses however, the film is rated 18 for a reason and some of the best action movies ever made don't exactly have the deepest narratives either so neither of those are going to bother me when settling down for an action movie.Chris Hemsworth plays black market mercenary Tyler Rake, who accepts the deadliest mission of his career when tasked with an extraction of the kidnapped son of an imprisoned international crime lord. There's your narrative, it's a basic set up and it knows it, and they sure as hell waste no time in getting down to the nitty gritty stuff.Sam Hargrave comes from a background of working on stunts for some pretty high profile films and he certainly utilises that here in his directorial debut. Hargrave goes for the serious approach to his film so there isn't much time to stop for any comedy, which suits the film's fast-paced and brutal action sequences down to a tee. One in particular, a long take action sequence that moves from vehicles to an apartment block before falling down to the streets, is up there as one of the most impressive action sequences I've seen in a film, the swift camera movements and stunt choreography really something to behold.Hemsworth leads the film well with a dominating screen presence, whether it be scoring headshot after headshot on an armed unit or slapping a bunch of adolescent soldiers about. The physicality of the performance is demanding and it's impressively handled by everyone involved.The film does drag a little in places and it feels as if 15-20 minutes could be shaved off but I'd be lying if I said that I wasn't engrossed by what was happening throughout. Extraction has the added bonus of the lead character with the surname Rake actually killing someone with a rake. Bravo.

title: Fantastic fight & stunt scenes
text: I'm actually surprised this isn't rated higher. I mean, who taps Play on an Action film about a fearless mercenary and them complains about too much violence or lack of plot? I really like action films and this is one is flawless in the acting and direction. It also may be one of the most violent I've seen recently. But I was very impressed with the fight scenes! And turns out the Director is a stunt man himself. So there you go! The fight scenes and action were so good that the camera actually holds the shot instead of leaving it to the viewer's imagination. I was impressed at the level of acting and stamina it must take to follow through on these scenes. And with most of the cast being unknowns, we have to be impressed by the direction. You literally can't look away or you'll miss something. The plot was actually believable on the most basic level though not novel. And yes, at some point one wonders if it makes enough sense. There's a lot of innuendo instead of all the hand holding that Hollywood inserts, which I appreciated - giving the audience some credit for intelligence. All the cast did a great job but big props to Chris for working hard here and I hope Sam continues to direct action films.

text:

title: Great action piece and over the top camera work.
text: A linear flick with a simple, easy to follow plot. Amazing action sequences and beautiful shots. The 12 minutes continuous shot is one of the best continuous shots I've ever seen. Filled with a lot of blood and brutal scenes. Very John Wick-ish. Fight scenes are well executed and we'll performed. Doesn't get boring for even a minute. Count the number of Bangladeshis this guy kills. I dare you.

title: Good action movie but poor script writing
text: The action scenes looked quite real and impressive. However, the emotional sense that I believe the director was going for...never really blossomed.

title: It does it's best to give the worst impression about Dhaka
text:
This movie was so pathetic, especially for Bangladeshis. It was Hargrave's efforts to make Dhaka look wholly like a slum and not the megacity it is turning out to be. Efforts to make the city full of criminal kids who carry guns.
For the sake of rescuing a druglord's son, you tend to kill hundreds of men who appear to be uninformed as Bangladeshi Police and Army surely make the Bangladeshi inside us feel grow a distaste towards such a movie.And it was so disappointing to hear dead hindi songs here and there as I'm sure it wouldn't hurt to take some songs from Dhallywood plus the Bengali speaking actors were so annoying to watch as they sound anything else than BangladeshiOh, and when does the "Sultana Kamal Bridge" over the Buriganga get you to India?. Who would have thought Dhaka is so close to our neighbor India?

title: Elite Modern Action
text: Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) falls straight into the bad ass column with company such as John Wick. 'Extraction' and 'John Wick' are quite different kinds of movies, but they are both upper echelon action. Hemsworth is an absolute beast and electric throughout.As stated with other reviews the plot is simple, which I have absolutely no issue with. Too often nowadays films are muddled with confusing or unrealistic plot twists. Something like this it's best to keep it to the point with the focus on fantastic action sequences.Speaking of action sequences, how about that continuous scene of 11 minutes and change? This is of course accomplished with several takes and gives the illusion of an uninterrupted thrill ride, but impressive nonetheless. That long of an exciting scene reminded me of the one at the beginning of 'The Revenant'It was nice to see Hollywood and Bollywood come to together and make this. It's not often we see movies like this take place in this part of the world.With the limited amount of movies we got in 2020, 'Extraction' is likely my favourite action movie of the year. A non stop adrenaline rush that delivers high quality fight choreography, stunts, and competent gun fighting. This is no doubt due to director, Sam Hargrave's extensive knowledge and experience in those areas. Well worth the watch.

title: WHY DO I WATCH A MOVIE?
text: It depends. If it stars Chris Hemsworth it is to be entertained. And does he ever check that box. People say it's not realistic...blah blah blah. Very clear GOOD GUYS and BAD GUYS. And a great ending. I loved it.

title: Major Disappointment

title: Excellent action, gritty, beautiful imaginery, a tad too long
text: Extraction is a great directing debut from Sam Hargrave, a former stuntman and fight coordinator in blockbuster films like Avengers and Captain America. Exploding, inventive and clear action scenes, awesome 11+ minute "single shot" -section and great use of exotic locations, colourful environment and sound effects.Chris Hemsworth fights his way through with effortless charisma and believability. All the other characters, from evil drug lords to lowly gang members are well written, and given some human background. Even if there are some stereotypes too.If the movie was cut 15-20 minutes shorter, it would have been even better - the brutal action gets a little repetitive towards the end. Bodycount is high.But overall, great action film and I recommend watching and following Sam Hargrave to discuss making of the action scenes - his enthusiasm, dedication and professional background shines bright trough! Looking forward to a sequel.

title: Action packed

title: Great action scenes
text: This movie has great action scenes. Not only because the fight choreography are actually impressive. The camera work is too. Chris is convincing as this character. His performance is actually quite good. The story line is much better than many action movies, so worth to watch. And I appreciate it that this movie isn't based in The States for a change. The violence is quite excessive though.I understand people feel offended how Dhaka is portrayed and that it isn't realistic. But honestly, it's a movie. It's almost never accurate. How many times don't you see Hawaii, while the movie is supposedly set in South America for example. Or you're supposedly watching a scene in Amsterdam, while it's a square in a different country. And wooden clogs are added to make it authentic, because people apparently believe that's what Dutch people still use these days. It's stupid, but point is, it is the movies. The main goal is to create a cool action movie, not an accurate portray of the chosen location.

title: Great action movie. Didn't expect it to be this good.

The plot was simple but solid, and rarely took me out of the movie. The acting was good as well, and the characters were cast correctly. Hemsworth plays this role well. It wasn't perfect, as there were a couple times where you are asked to sort of "just go with it", but overall really good. Very pleasantly surprised.

title: Excellent popcorn action movie!
text: After reading many of the "reviews" here, I have to wonder if they actually watched the movie at all. You saw the previews and knew what you were getting, so the logic of people complaining that this wasn't "Citizen Kane" is lost on me. For those who don't know, this was a film adaptation of a "graphic novel" (comic book, for those over 30) and that genre is not well-known for its engaging storytelling.Let me say up front -- the cinematography, fight choreography and seamless special effects (camera behind the car, pulling up alongside, outside the car, panning back and forth, then suddenly *inside* the car, exiting the other side in a long, unbroken chase scene... take a bow FX guys!) combine with a story that's unexpectedly complex for its simplistic origins.All the actors turned in amazing performances, even though all but the two leads didn't have a great deal to work with. Randeep Hooda was particularly memorable as his character wasn't the cookie-cutter character as his motivations are revealed.In short, if you have a couple hours to spare and need a bit of high-octane escapism that doesn't require you to turn your brain off, you may enjoy this. I certainly did!

title: Shows what's possible with an action cinema in 2020
text:
Extraction is an adrenaline pumping ride for you action movie lovers that's gonna put you on the edge of your seats! It features intricately choreographed fight sequences that are made in a way never seen before! The whole movie is pretty much one non-stop gun fight! The cinematography to achieve this is crazy immersive. It put's you right in the middle of the action! Must have had one of the best camera crews in the whole industry!
Finally I wanna say, the action, though gruesome was not entirely mindless. The movie had some deeply emotional moments. Good job with the story Joe Russo! It's not very often that you find action movies with a non-cliche story!

title: GOOD ACTION (& NO HAMMER IN SIGHT)...!
text: A Netflix original from 2020 starring Thor, Chris Hemsworth, as a mercenary tasked to rescue a kidnapped son of a jailed drug lord. The boy lives his life simply; going to school, dreaming of girls & getting back to an empty home run by his father's partner who tries to keep a tight leash on him. One night however, after leaving a club & smoking dope outside, some cops pull up & the boys try to play the offense away but when guns are drawn & the boy's friends are gunned down, he's taken hostage but no immediate demands are given. It turns out a rival drug lord has taken the kid to a neighboring country so Hemsworth, an Aussie military man, all biceps & emotional chips on his shoulders, & his team, including his liaison played by Golshifteh Farahani, warns him about the tenuous nature of the job but Hemsworth pushes forward regardless & although the initial snatching up of the boy goes easily (for a seasoned professional!), backstabs & betrayals occur when Hemsworth's team start getting knocked off by the boy's father's handler (he's been warned by the father to get the son back or forfeit his own family) while the kidnapper sends crooked cops en masse in hot pursuit to stop Hemsworth & the boy from crossing a particular bridge to freedom (& where the same guy who betrayed them suddenly joins the cause) w/every shot bullet felt & every blinding explosion forcing one to turn away, this is a thrill a minute actioner w/some inventive camerawork (an extended knife fight between Hemsworth & the nominal baddie is a treat for action hounds). David Harbour shows up as an old friend of Hemsworth's to lend a hand when things get particularly tough.

title: Finally a Great Action Movie. Not a Single Dull Moment.
text: This movie is everything you would expect going into it and much more. Very impressed by Chris Hemsworth's action sequences. It's Jason Borne meets John Wick, Call of Duty style. Would love to see CH in the next Mission Impossible movie.The 12min-long single camera shot was sick. All the supporting roles were great. The most entertaining movie Netflix has put out so far during this PC & girl-power pandemic. Maybe they're beginning to choose entertainment over wokeness. One can only hope.

title: Truly great acting producing and directing.
text: For many good shows there is a lot left that leaves the best audience with questions and doubts or simply shaking their heads saying, 'that just wouldn't happen like that,' or 'that is not very well planned or realistic....'Not so with Extraction; This is very very well acted produced and directed, the realism and the special effects, the acting and all concerned are exceptional and Not only is it one of Chris' best acting jobs, but many supporting actors as well. I am thoroughly impressed with all that went into this and the outcome is worth a 'standing o' . I hope they make use of this and make a sequel. What a really good movie. Even the long running shows I like do not come close to the planning, artistry and considerations that went into this. I will stop here because I will just keep going on about how everyone did in this great movie from behind and within.

title: Amazing Netflix Action Movie!
text:
Beautiful and amazing people of Bangladesh, please do not be offended, this is just an action movie! No one watching this is judging your beautiful country, or its friendly and loving people.Extraction! Did I just watched another John Wick? Or Equalizer? Was it the best Netflix action movie? 100% YES!Story wise, you are watching an action movie about a kidnapping a child in a country with corrupted government and military which is not a new thing in movies! We have watched similar to it many times! But what makes Extraction very unique and fun, it is it's amazing cinematography and outstanding acting that made it emotional enough to feel connected to the characters. And let me tell you about the crazy thriller 15 minutes of single shot fight/shooting scene! That was just a pure art!
This movie contains very realistic and outstanding action scenes, Chris Hemsworth is loved for his previous amazing performances, and he does a superb job once again, and makes you connected to his characters. It is absolutely one of the best action movies with an outstanding cinematography and directing!

title: It's captivating in bits and pieces
text: To me the movie seemed solid and with flavor. Certainly not the best in the genre but then it sure is one time watch.In these elongated single shot sequence movies or in action movies in general, the story always goes for toss, I still don't understand the point of fast and furious but they are enjoyable. Exceptions would be Bourne series which has a lot more gripping tale to tell although action is the main focus. This movie story assessment falls in between. The plot is not the high point.The high point are the action sequences. There is a floating sense of bourne series, a touch of 'the raid' specially the fights within buildings. some of the gun shooting are slick.Chris Hemsworth in my opinion overshadows others mostly by his strong physical appearance, Other mention would be Randeep Hooda, he had his presence marked, all others did what they are supposed to do, no stellar performances.Now few words about misrepresentation of Dhaka, I feel movie as a form in itself is a misrepresentation, If you want a true representation look for a Documentary. Slumdog millionaire won Oscar though people were pissed off because it misrepresented Mumbai (Bombay). Here is the thing, When you are making a commercial movie, You look for bare minimum and you stroke the preconceived notions of people. They highlight the things which fascinates people, I personally didn't like the overuse of chromatic lighting to make street looks dirtier. But then I feel you are not doing yourself a favor by being offended.All in all it's a one time watch with good action sequences and it's always pleasing to watch Chris Hemsworth who also produced the movie.

title: A celebration of high octane action wrapped around a hollow plot
text: Extraction - It's high octane action, display of brawn and muscles, a celebration of firearms and a whole lot of blood & gore. That's Extraction for you. The story is a wrap around the central theme - more action. Since this has already made you curious, Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth), a mercenary working on death defying assignments, is given the responsibility of extracting Ovi Mahajan Jr. (Rudraksh Jaiswal), the son of an international crime lord Ovi Mahajan Sr. (Pankaj Tripathi, in a blink and you miss role) from the den of another crime lord Amir Asif (Priyanshu Paiyuli), based in Dhaka. Also in the fray to rescue Ovi is Saju (Randeep Hooda) who works for Ovi Sr., under the threat that the failure will lead to the elimination of Saju's family.It's a formulaic pot boiler really. The only difference is that there's very little spoken stuff, exchanges are mostly in the form of armed combats, car chases and raining bullets. In its cheapest form, the hand to hand combats are with a myriad of knives, or anything else that is found handy. The high point in the film for me was when Hemsworth speaks in Bangla asking for evidence, "Promaan Dao" (show me the evidence, for those who didn't know), not once but thrice stunning the original captors and the dumb struck audience - I am almost certain that the looks on our faces would have mirrored those he was addressing on screen. Well, after a couple of hours of mayhem Ovi is indeed rescued but not before almost everyone dies. The film gets full marks for the fight fest and zero for anyone's acting - actually no one needed to act. Shataf Figar makes his presence felt inadequate small role of a sniper in Dhaka.

title: Sponsored by Tupperware
text: The story is not as straight forward as I thought it might be, there are a few genuine twists that makes it fresh. There's also some smart levity in it but it is an action movie.The action looks like it hurt, it's violent AF, intense and vicious. They let it breath, literally, making it feels real and very much like you're in it with them. As a result there is not much suspension of disbelief needed. The fight scenes, close quarters fighting chases and gun battle have a danger feel to them and a high cost throughout the film. I have a favorite fight scene though, all I'll say is kids.The directing is very smart with the tracking, using the idea of camera posing to hide the stuntman but using it in tracking shots, making us watch one way at some interesting thing while you know what's happening off camera, then picking back up to where we were it's amazing. Sam Hargrave delivers big time, he's one to watch.The acting is amazing, top notch, it pluses the story and help carry the emotional weight. The cast is region accurate and the actors are great. Hemsworth did not hog the screen time - take note Robbie - and was surrounded by talented actors.By the way I totally spotted a Thor reference, did you ?Extraction, sponsored by Tupperware - don't think I missed the Tupperware bottle Hemsworth gave the kid - is a really good movie. Hargrave, Hemsworth, and Joe Russo delivered.@garcwrites

title: Know what you're signing up for, and you won't be disappointed
text:
I see 80% of the reviews here are from natives of Bangladesh, who seem to be very unhappy about the way their capital (Dhaka) and their country have been represented in this movie. Well, I don't give a rat's eye about that, neither do I bother about any emotional core or a crackerjack of a story, because hey, anyone who has seen the trailer SHOULD KNOW that this movie ain't about any of that. At no point in time have those associated in the making of this movie given the impression that this will be anything more than an out-and-out action movie, and I assure you that it surely delivers on that front.
The action choreography is brilliant! Raw, visceral, brutal and realistically shot with real world stakes. The centrepiece action sequence, a one-take shot that moves from a car chase to a building shootout to a knife fight to finally a truck chase, is a marvel! Chris Hemsworth excels and so does Randeep Hooda and Rudraksh Jaiswal.
BOTTOMLINE : If you're a fan of action movies in the same vein as of John Wick, Raid or Atomic Blonde, do give this movie a chance. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Not worth the time.

title: They made the movie they wanted.
text: To be honest, I was able to watch this movie for free and enjoyed it to some extent, but I would not recommend it to anyone wishing to see a 'meaningful' film. It is not that. It is a typical 'action' movie with some good moments, especially some of the tracking shots and even some well done tender moments. It is not realistic, nor is it meant to be. It holds no deep or thoughtful presence, but it does display to some extent the living conditions of the poor in the Indian subcontinent.The creators made the movie that they wanted, and, for that reason, I award them with a ten star rating.

title: Good action flick.
text: What more can you say? The production values are impressive, the action is directed stellar for most of the time and Chris Hemsworth is a great action hero.The plot itself isn't amazing, but it serves enough reason for all the shooting, kicking and screaming. I'm surprised some people are annoyed by this, as this didn't seem to be a problem with Max Max Fury Road or John Wick - Great movies in their own right. Instead it focuses on what it also does best: The juicy action! Hemsworth is hands-on, he sure took quite some beating while making. His character is written well enough to feel believeable and his acting is on par. Same goes for Randeep Hooda, who is quite explosive as the antagonist.Most of the creativity and talent by the crew was spent in the first half and it shows. The camera work and the direction is simply amazing, the car chase scene left me puzzeling what was going on (in a good way). Sadly the creativity drops off quite going towards the ending, which is a little disappointing. It all becomes a little too predictable and cheesy.Nevertheless a highly recommendable no-bullshit action flick.

title: This is an Action Film "."
text: Apparently this needs to be repeated. This is an action film. It appears that some were sorely disappointed that it was not a rom-com, a period drama or an "important film". However, as an action movie, it is far better than average. In terms of intensity, originality, and production value, this is often on par with John Wick. True the plot is not particularly intricate and the character development is minimal, but much is done with little. There is no sense that any of the actors are phoning in the performance because on paper they aren't given much of an opportunity to show other dimensions. The movie covers events over a short period of time and the characters are focused on the issues at hand. There are a few breathers but we aren't sidetracked into forced "lets talk about us" scenes in the middle of life or death struggle. With the superhero genre beaten to death, a straight-forward fast-paced entertaining film is an increasingly rare gem and well worth the watch.

title: Hardcore Hemsworth
text: Loved it. A new hero to rival Denzel's Man of Fire and Equaliser. Hemsworth is on a mission that goes south more times than he gets shot! title: Soft racism?
text: We have a white dude killing an impossible amount of "browns" (arabs) gangsters, showing how superior he is in both, skill and smarts, but also being the better person (a criminal, but a good one, with a past yes, but haunts him because he is in fact good), when compared with the diabolical enemies.To get there, the writers had to force alot of scenes, losing every bit of the realism gained by the setting and production. In the end, this movie is as realistic as any superhero movie (and less than many of them, even).Having said that, the action is superb. While the characters aren't more than avatars and the story as thin as possible (rescuing X, in the hands of X in the City X), the chase sequences and shootouts are insane. Some are "one take" long shots. Not in the ridiculously boring 1917 way, with minutes and minutes of nothing BUT IN ONE SHOT. And not in the unnecessary Birdman way, that brought nothing to the story, but more in the "Children of Men" way (even if that movie is way better).For the action? 10 pts. For all the rest? 0 pts. Result? 5 pts.

title: Honestly wasn't expecting much
text: For a director debut, it was very good! The action sequences are honestly incredible, the plot is weak and if the Russo brothers didn't have their names attached, it wouldn't of been such a high budget. Character development is poor as I didn't feel too attached to any of them but that's fine, the film knows it's a gritty action packed film and keeps to that, the character development as I said is poor but is there to help you try and rout for them to survive. Most Netflix films are trash and I turn them off after the first 20 minutes but I really didn't want to turn this one off. You can easily tell that the director was a former stuntman as the action sequences are so good, for me, they are up there with some of the John Wick fights, Chris Hemsworth does well with the role and it's good to see him play a role with a lot more grit and an almost darker side than I've seen in a while especially compared to the MCU.If the action sequences weren't as good then this would get a 5, they make that much of a difference!

title: Gory, stylish, brilliant action! Just watch it!
text: Let me begin my review by saying THIS FILM ISNT ABOUT BANGLADESH!! this film is set there not trying to show it as being horrible place it was just a different setting. Dont let those reviews turn you away!Now this film had its pros and cons the cons il say is that the story isnt too strong but easy to stay with. Now the pros the action and wow oh wow I want to see chris do films more like this. It was shot wonderfully I couldn't keep my eyes of the screen it was like watching a amped up Jason bourne. Used everything at his disposal and its shot in a similar 1917 style one shot during certain action scenes which really set the bar and the gore left me watching the screen cringing as made me feel there pain.This film would of been a 10 if the story was better but for an easy Friday night action film it's a treat. Also stop listening to reviews about the setting it's an action film not a documentary!

title: High-octane action flick
text: When the son of an Indian druglord is kidnapped and taken to Bangladesh, Australian mercenary Tyler Rake is hired to retrieve him. Yes, the plot is simple, but I don't necessarily see that taking away anything from the movie. With the intensity of 'Rambo', but the stylish precision of 'John Wick', this film is a perfect example of what an action movie should look like in 2020. The action sequences are simply breathtaking; each and every action sequence is wonderfully crafted and some camera angles during the fights are surprisingly awesome. There are incredible hand-to-hand combats, exciting chases and other fantasically choreographed stunts that makes this film the most exciting, and joyously violent, film of 2020. There's even some good dark humour in there too. Chris Hemsworth gives one of the best performance of his career. Not only is he incredibly physical in the role, but I actually believed the emotional side of his character; which with Hemsworth isn't usually the case. The supporting cast is also great; as is the cinematography; sound design and the excellent hair and makeup department. All in all, Extraction is a fun, action-filled film with little story but it doesn't matter.

title: Best Action movie since Terminator 2
text:
The entire plot is contained in the film's title. It's about the rescue of a kidnapped boy in Bangladesh and a team of Australian mercenaries is supposed to fix it.+ The best action scenes since Terminator 2.+ Excellent first feature from a director who previously worked as a stuntman
+ Chris Hemsworth fits perfectly as the lead
+ Few cuts, down to earth fights
+ The main and supporting actors often have to work as a team, Rambo style alone is not always enough
+ Everyone, including and especially Hemsworth, is shown as vulnerable
+ Despite plot armor, Hemsworth's character keeps making mistakes he has to correct....
+ ... and also shows emotions again and again
+ The story has exciting turning points....
Conclusion: A mix of Rambo, Terminator 2 and Tears of the Sun, but still original and very well done by all rules of action art. A few clich√© weaknesses and a not quite well thought-out plot are missing for the best rating.

title: WOW ! Forget about the triggered Bangladeshi crybabies, this movie kicks ass !
text: This movie doesn't claim to be an Oscar nominee so kindly do not view the movie with those channeled expectations. Trust me, I've been there, it's much worse. Also the accent is definitely not West Bengal, it's Bangladeshi for sure. It's just easy to raise questions on authenticity when you feel disappointed about the portrayal of your country, but kindly do not let it come in the way while enjoying a movie.The film juggles with the concept of internal conflicts, mercy killing, guilt nd walking the right path even if the odds are stacked against you, and does a good job of it. A great action flick, do give it a watch !

title: Where does Netflix get the courage to make the law enforcement forces and the proud army of this country smaller ?
text:
Oh i see...
1. This country is a country of drug lords where the police, elite force (RAB) and even our proud army all work under one drug lord.
2. There is a lack of men in this country, so young children become soldiers of the drug lord with AK-47s in their hands, as happens in Myanmar, Somalia and other countries.
3. There is no air defense or air force in this country, a few Firingi forces flee in civilian helicopters after washing the country's army, police, RAB, but no one intercepts it.
4. Bangladesh is an extremist, corrupt, drug empire state.
I agree with everything, but where does Netflix get the courage to make the law enforcement forces and the proud army of this country smaller?
5. Bangladesh is a country where all the yellow can be seen, the yellow filter is seen in the movie Bangladesh Scenes.What will you think about this country if you watch a movie in Murikan or European without hearing the name Bangladesh once in your life?

title: Fun movie, doesn't hate itself seriously and is an entertaining action movie
text: The movie has fantastic action scenes that are no doubt gory and over the top, but in no way absurd or cringe. Overall, the movie is an entertaining action movie with appealing sentimental moments in the characters. Those sentimental moments don't take themselves to seriously, and they shouldn't either. But by far, and like how I pointed out, the main plus point of the movie is the great actions. Writing and story wise, yeah there are some cons but who cares. The movie knows what it's trying to achieve and does it. For that reason, I rated it a 9, but admittedly the movie, if I were a professional critic, is a 6.5 or 7.

title: Above Average Plot, Above Average Acting, But the Beautiful chaos makes up for EVERYTHING LACKING!
text: First of all I'm a South African, and as a African I can say first hand Africa has been misrepresented countless of times EVEN BY BOLLYWOOD. BUT with that said let me remind my Indian brothers and sisters this is a fictional movie meant for entertainment not a true story based on the life of Mahatma Gandhi so please get off your high horses and just get some popcorn. I've been to plenty Cities in India and while there's many beautiful gems to be found - all the difficult things to look at in this movie is also still VERY MUCH a reality still I KNOW THIS first hand. This is a GOOD movie but because its being rated so unfairly my rating must balance out the clear discrimination here. #teamextractionsequal

title: This is not Dhaka
text: 1. Children don't carry rifles on the streets of Dhaka in broad daylight. It's a horrible misrepresentation shown in the movie. If I didn't live in Dhaka myself, I would be mistaken into thinking child terrorism is normal in Dhaka.2. Law enforcers in Dhaka - whether it be DMP, RAB or any of the defense organizations - are NOT incompetent and incapable of stopping two random guys flying in from outside the country. They do their job well, which is why we can go out, visit places, hang out with friends and more without worrying about random shootings (like they show in the movie).3. Dhaka's streets are NOT violent and it's NOT normal for people to fight in public with guns and swords. The movie made it seem like the people are used to things like these happening and somehow it's the norm here.4. An entire movie set to be in Dhaka and not a SINGLE major Bangladeshi character played by someone who SPEAKS the language and dialect that we do in Bangladesh? Are you for real, Netflix? All the major characters spoke Bengali like they do in West Bengal / Kolkata - NOT how we speak in Bangladesh - although they were representing characters in Bangladesh. Why?

title: The plot of this year's best movie
text: Movie is amazing, everyone's acting was also right. The action scenes are very joss!

title: It is what it is. And for what it is, it's very good.
text: Chris Hemsworth plays mercenary Tyler Rake in the thriller 'Extraction'. At two hours in length the film is ninety minutes of fighting and thirty minutes of explanatory dialogue. To judge this film fairly it should be held up alongside other films in the over-the-top thriller genre; The John Wicks and the Jason Bournes. And, in fact, it holds up very well.Here's the story. Tyler Rakes will be paid a lot of money to free a boy from the clutches of an evil Bangladeshi drug lord. The boy's father is in jail; he's an evil drug lord himself. So we've got battling drug lords. Add to the mix the boy's former personal protector, and then throw in a military officer who is on the take from the Bangladeshi drug lord, and you've got a lot of people attempting to get their hands on that kid.The combat scenes are flat out great. Many of them involve a camera in close pursuit of the antagonists so that we feel that we are racing up those steps, or leaping from roof-top to roof-top along with the combatants. If this sort of camera work has been so well done before - or done at all - I cannot remember it. The fights appear to be 'the real thing' and not a choreographed piece of action. On the downside, in John Wick his adversaries die by the hundreds; but it's Ok because nothing in the film feels particularly true to life. In Extraction, because it DOES feel real, the deaths of so many fighters made me ... sad. I couldn't help thinking; Don't their lives count for anything?Finally, why 8 stars and not 10? Here's why. No matter how good the fight scenes are, by a certain point I'd had enough. Maybe at one and three quarter hours out of the film's two hour length. Ok, I get it, I get the idea. Can we please wrap this up?Not a good reaction to what, to that point, had been great.

title: All about Chris, Just Action
text: It's Extraction and that's just how I like it. Chris simply nailed it, and not to forget the young Indian actor Rudhraksh Jaiswal and the more experienced actor Randeep Hooda who both did not fail to deliver. The end was really emotional and brought me down in tears. The plot overall could have some improvements, but it does not take away much from the film. The primary villain needed some more motivating factors, but the film will make you hate him enough to root for anyone who stands against him. I loved the scary & dangerous atmosphere & the frantic explosive action that bursts out of nowhere & makes everything feel on edge & intense. An exciting survival Thriller that feels real & intense as hell. A wild thrilling ride with great performances & gory blood soaked action.

title: Poor representing of BD.
text: No story, poor research on Bangladesh. Worst representation of Dhaka, Army, police, environment, people's clothing, houses, Bangla accent. Every one is listening Bollywood song for no reason. All the security forces are working under a so called drug lord. Directors try to portray Bangladesh as a country of violence, child labour, poor, crime which are not true.Should be banned since offendable representation of the armed forces of a country who has the second highest contribution in the UN peace mission.

title: Pretty good action movie
text: I felt like this film did its job very well. It's entertaining and the action sequences are for the most part great. Had some issues with the CGI on that laughably unrealistic jump at the beginning + some not so good explosions and missile animations AND a one-time green screen goof. Other than that it was very visually pleasing. The plot on the other end had some issues like a lot of "pure action" movies. Overall it was predictable and used a bit too much "plot-armor" for my liking. BUT... I didn't go into this film expecting an amazing plot so I wasn't disappointed or felt like it took away from the overall experience. A solid 9 for its genre. Badass. Exciting. Violent.
